0.title: Heatwave warnings issued for several states, IMD releases list
0.article_body: Heatwave condition in isolated places is very likely over Jharkhand during June 10-12 and over Punjab, Haryana-Delhi, Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan on June 10 and 11. IMD also predicted heatwave in Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Odisha on June 10. There's likely to be no significant change in maximum temperatures over northwest and central India during next 48 hours.

1.title: Take the extra mile: Wizz Air CEO asks staff to work through fatigue
1.article_body: European airline Wizz Air's CEO József Váradi is facing criticism after he told his staff that too many crew members were refusing to fly when fatigued. He said, "We're all fatigued but sometimes it is required to take the extra mile...We cannot run this business when every fifth person of a base reports sickness because the person is fatigued."

2.title: Ranbir is 'extremely loving, calls me ma'am': 'Animal' co-star Rashmika
2.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna, in a recent interview, shared her experience of working with 'Animal' co-star Ranbir Kapoor. "He's extremely loving," Rashmika stated, while calling Ranbir an "easygoing" person. "And he's the only one in the whole industry who calls me "ma'am," and I do not like it," Rashmika added. Directed by Sandeep Reddy Vanga, 'Animal' went on floors in Manali.

3.title: Man throws acid on woman for turning down marriage proposal in B'luru
3.article_body: A 36-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly throwing acid on a woman for turning down his marriage proposal in Bengaluru on Friday, police said. The 32-year-old woman, a divorcee with three children, sustained injuries in her right eye and is undergoing treatment in a private hospital, they added. The victim had known the accused for the past three years.

4.title: No signs of Russian military threat to Sweden & Finland: NATO
4.article_body: NATO's Deputy Secretary-General Mircea Geoana said that at present he sees no immediate military threat from Russia to aspiring NATO members, Sweden and Finland. Geoana also said he's confident that Sweden and Finland will join the military alliance despite Turkey's objection. Turkey has opposed Sweden and Finland's NATO bids accusing them of harbouring Kurdish militants and other terror groups.

5.title: Shutdown in J&K's Srinagar over ex-BJP leaders' remarks on Prophet
5.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar observed a shutdown on Friday in protest against former BJP leaders Nupur Sharma and Naveen Kumar Jindal's remarks on Prophet Muhammad. Shops and other business establishments remained closed at the Lal Chowk, among other parts of the city. As per reports, authorities suspended mobile internet services in Jammu, while broadband services remained operational.

6.title: Abu Dhabi's ADIA to buy 20% stake in IIFL Home Finance for ₹2,200 cr
6.article_body: Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) will invest ₹2,200 crore for a 20% stake in IIFL Home Finance. As of March 31, 2022, IIFL Finance's home loan arm has Assets Under Management of ₹23,617 crore. The deal will reportedly value the lender at ₹11,000 crore. It will mark one of the biggest investments in the affordable housing segment in India.

7.title: Israelis will be allowed to attend FIFA WC in Qatar: Officials
7.article_body: Despite not having formal diplomatic relations with Qatar, Israeli ministers have said that the country's residents will be allowed to visit Qatar for this year's FIFA World Cup. "Love of football and sport connects people and states, and the World Cup in November opens a new door for us to warm ties," Israel's Foreign Minister Yair Lapid said.

8.title: Sham trial: US after 3 foreigners who fought for Ukraine sentenced to death
8.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken raised concern about a "sham trial" after two British fighters and a Moroccan captured while fighting for Ukraine were sentenced to death by a court in the Russian-occupied Donetsk region of Ukraine. "We call on Russia and its proxies to respect international humanitarian law, including the rights and protections afforded prisoners of war," Blinken added.

9.title: Policeman opens fire, kills woman then shoots self dead in WB
9.article_body: An on-duty police officer allegedly shot himself dead after he opened fire outside Bangladesh Deputy High Commission in West Bengal's Kolkata on Friday, police said. A woman, who was riding pillion on a two-wheeler, was hit by a bullet during the firing and died on the spot, police added. "The whole episode lasted for around five minutes," an eyewitness said.

10.title: Govt failed miserably in creating jobs for youth: KTR writes to PM Modi
10.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao has written an open letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi over the unemployment issue in the country and claimed that the BJP-led central government has failed miserably in creating jobs for the youth. "There are only 'pakoda' employment opportunities in the country today, all thanks to the inefficient policies of the Union government," he stated.

11.title: Sri Lanka creates 2 new ministries to deal with economic crisis
11.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has created two new ministries to deal with the severe economic crisis in the country. The Ministry of Technology and Investment Promotion was created to promote foreign direct investment (FDI) in the country. The Ministry of Women, Child Affairs and Social Empowerment includes 15 national institutions and departments, according to a local report.

12.title: Goldman Sachs CEO shares 5 tips for interns, includes 'Be an entrepreneur'
12.article_body: Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon shared some advice with the incoming interns at the global investment bank. In an email, Solomon advised the interns to "take the long view" and "be an entrepreneur". He asked them to "embrace evolution" and to listen and ask questions. "Make time to do things that you want to do because they...excite you," he added.

13.title: Stones pelted in UP's Prayagraj over Prophet remarks row, ADG's car damaged
13.article_body: Massive protests broke in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj on Friday against alleged inflammatory remarks on Prophet Muhammad by former BJP leaders. Police said people raised slogans and pelted stones in Atala area after the Friday prayers ended. The car of Prayagraj ADG, who was on the ground to take control of the law and order situation, was damaged during the protest.

14.title: Massive protests erupt across India over ex-BJP leaders' remarks on Prophet
14.article_body: Protests were held in Delhi and several other cities across India on Friday over ex-BJP leaders Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal's remarks on Prophet Muhammad. Protests and stone-pelting were reported in several cities of UP including Lucknow, Saharanpur, Moradabad and Prayagraj. West Bengal's Kolkata, Punjab's Ludhiana, Telangana's Hyderabad, Jharkhand's Ranchi and J&K's Srinagar also saw protests.

15.title: Andre Russell gifts himself Mercedes-Benz AMG GT R after IPL 2022, pics surface
15.article_body: West Indies and KKR all-rounder Andre Russell gifted himself a Mercedes-Benz AMG GT R sports car after IPL 2022. Pictures of Russell standing near his new buy have surfaced. Russell also shared a video, writing, "As a ghetto yute I always dream big! But with hard work and sacrifices, dreams become reality. God is good."

16.title: 28-year-old raped in 5-star hotel in Delhi's Dwarka by man she met on dating app
16.article_body: A 28-year-old woman has alleged that she was raped by a man, whom she met on a dating app, in a five-star hotel in Delhi's Dwarka area, the police said. DCP (Dwarka) M Harsha Vardhan said, "The accused did not answer her calls after that and she lodged an FIR against him. The accused is a resident of Hyderabad."

17.title: Scarlett Johansson to star in Kristin Scott Thomas' 'My Mother's Wedding'
17.article_body: Actress Scarlett Johansson has signed on to star in the upcoming film 'My Mother's Wedding'. The film will mark the feature directorial debut of Kristin Scott Thomas, who has co-written the script with John Micklethwait. According to Deadline, Sienna Miller, Emily Beecham and Freida Pinto will also feature in the movie produced by Finola Dwyer and Steven Rales.

18.title: EU Parliament firmly behind Ukraine’s candidacy bid: Prez Metsola
18.article_body: The European Union's Parliament "stands firmly" behind Ukraine's bid to achieve candidate status to join the European Union, the Parliament's President Roberta Metsola said. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in April completed the first step in obtaining European Union membership for Ukraine by submitting a questionnaire. Ukraine currently has an association agreement with the EU.

19.title: Nick Jonas attends Jimmy Fallon's show with kalawa on his wrist, fans react
19.article_body: Singer Nick Jonas recently attended 'The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon' where he was seen wearing kalawa, a sacred red thread, on his wrist. Reacting to a video of Nick shared by 'The Tonight Show' on their official Instagram handle, a user wrote, "Did someone notice he is wearing a rakhsha dhaga," while another commented, "Work of Priyanka (Chopra)."

20.title: BMC employee befriends woman on FB, rapes her promising financial help
20.article_body: A Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation employee was arrested for allegedly raping a married woman he befriended on Facebook. The woman alleged that the accused promised to help her and her husband with their debt and raped her at a lodge in Chembur. When she threatened to file a complaint, he called her again, promising to pay money but raped her again.

21.title: Ordinance soon on online rummy games, committee formed: TN Govt
21.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government has said that it will soon come up with an ordinance to corner online rummy and other card games. A committee headed by a retired judge has been constituted to look into the matter. Notably, the ordinance is being promulgated to tackle incidents of people ending their lives after losing money in the game.

22.title: Fire breaks out in carpet and crockery factory in Delhi's Hamidpur
22.article_body: A fire broke out in the godown of a carpet and crockery factory in Delhi's Hamidpur on Thursday evening and no casualties were reported, officials said. As many as 23 fire tenders were rushed to the spot to combat the fire. The NOC was not taken from the concerned department while establishing the factory, a Delhi Fire Service official said.

23.title: Today people talk about pan-India stars, I think I was one: Sonali Bendre
23.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre in an interview described herself as a "pan-India star" and added that she has never in her life been appreciated for her performances. "I was very successful in Hindi," she said. "I was very successful in Telugu, Tamil, Maratha, all sorts. So, today you talk about pan-India stars, I think I was one," Sonali further said.

24.title: Jasleen Royal pays tribute to KK by singing 'Yaaron' at concert, shares video
24.article_body: Singer Jasleen Royal paid tribute to late singer KK at one of her recent concerts. She took to Instagram to share a video where she could be seen singing KK's 'Yaaron' at the concert. "Remember singing this with...my school and college friends at the top of our voices...I salute you KK sir! You'll live on forever," Jasleen wrote.

25.title: 2 workers hospitalised after they fall into a chocolate tank at Mars factory in US
25.article_body: Firefighters rescued two workers after they fell into a chocolate tank at the Mars M&M factory in the US. The duo stood waist-deep in chocolate until they were rescued after a hole was cut into the tank to help them exit it. While it is unclear how they fell into the tank, they were later hospitalised.

26.title: Happy to bat wherever and make a difference: Miller on his 64* vs India
26.article_body: David Miller, who scored 64*(31) while batting at number five in South Africa's seven-wicket win against India in first T20I, said he's happy to bat wherever and make a difference. "I've done well at number four in my domestic career but South Africa is a different story with world-class players in...lineup," he added. Miller was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

27.title: Need €500 million to save Barca: Barcelona's Economic Vice Prez
27.article_body: Barcelona's Economic Vice-President Eduard Romeu said a sum of 500 million euros is needed to "save" the club. "You could add 150 million euros to that in losses this season if we [don't] do anything," added Romeu. Barcelona President Joan Laporta Estruch said the club is currently in the "ICU" having been "clinically dead" when he arrived.

28.title: 12-yr-old Bhopal girl abducted for human trafficking, tortured with electric shocks
28.article_body: Police arrested two people for allegedly abducting a 12-year-old schoolgirl from a street in Bhopal and torturing her. The accused, who intended to sell her to repay their debts, reportedly drugged her, stuffed her into a sack and tortured her with electric shocks. She was rescued after a woman, who had heard a single shriek from kidnappers' home, informed police.

29.title: 2 including an 8-yr-old boy killed after being hit by car in UP's Ballia
29.article_body: Two people, including an eight-year-old boy, died and two were injured after being hit by an SUV in Bhojpur village in UP's Ballia. The deceased were identified as Kishan (8) and Devnath (42) while Paswan (30) and Kundan Bharti (9) sustained injuries. Accused were consuming alcohol when they hit the pedestrians before ramming into a tree, police said.

30.title: Shows of Akshay's 'Samrat Prithviraj' cancelled due to zero occupancy: Reports
30.article_body: Shows of Akshay Kumar and Manushi Chhillar starrer 'Samrat Prithiviraj' have recently been cancelled in some cities due to zero occupancy in theatre halls, reports said. The occupancy was reported to be low in Mumbai, Kolkata and Bengaluru, although it performed marginally better in Delhi, Bollywood Hungama reported. The film had opened with ₹10.7 crore earnings on Friday.

31.title: Canada blocks & freezes over $310 mn in Russian assets amid war
31.article_body: Canadian police said they've frozen and blocked over $310 million in Russian assets and transactions from February 24-June 7 involving people sanctioned amid Moscow's war on Ukraine. In April, Canada said it'd change its sanctions law to allow for seized, sanctioned foreign assets to be redistributed as compensation to victims or to help in rebuilding a foreign state from war.

32.title: Cryptos akin to 'a world of Caribbean pirates' without regulation, says CEA
32.article_body: Chief Economic Adviser (CEA) V Anantha Nageswaran said that cryptocurrencies are akin to "a world of Caribbean pirates" in the absence of a centralised regulatory authority. He added that with more decentralisation in crypto, there exists a world of "winners take all". Commenting on the recent collapse of Terra ecosystem, Nageswaran said, "[It's a] very important cautionary tale."

33.title: Sensex crashes over 1,000 points to end at 54,303, logs worst week in a month
33.article_body: The Sensex crashed 1,017 points on Friday to settle at 54,303, while the Nifty closed 276 points lower at 16,201, logging the worst week in a month. The benchmark indices fell as European markets declined ahead of US inflation data. As many as 37 of the Nifty 50 stocks declined on Friday, while 13 of them posted gains.

34.title: 28-year-old raped in Delhi's Dwarka by man she met on dating app
34.article_body: A 28-year-old woman was allegedly raped by a man whom she met on a dating app in Delhi's Dwarka, police said. "A case of rape was registered after they received a complaint from the woman," police added. They went to a hotel where the accused offered the victim a drink laced with sedatives, police further said.

35.title: Aus, New Zealand unite amid China's growing influence in Pacific
35.article_body: After a meeting with New Zealand's PM Jacinda Ardern on Friday, Australia's PM Anthony Albanese said that the two countries are "in lockstep on the Pacific". This comes amid China's growing influence in the region. Australia and New Zealand have voiced concerns that China's security pact with the Solomon Islands could result in a Chinese military base being established there.

36.title: Voted for Cong as I love it: K'taka JD(S) MLA on Rajya Sabha polls
36.article_body: Karnataka JD(S) MLA K Srinivasa Gowda on Friday said he has voted for the Congress in the Rajya Sabha elections. When asked why, Gowda claimed he did so because he "loves the party". Along with Gowda, JD(S) MLA SR Srinivas from Gubbi has also reportedly voted for Congress. Six candidates are in the fray for four RS seats from Karnataka.

37.title: Man deadlifts 129.5 kg with just his middle finger in UK to break Guinness World Record
37.article_body: A man named Steve Keeler from UK has broken the Guinness World Record for the heaviest deadlift with one finger. Using just his middle finger, the Kent-based martial artist deadlifted 129.50 kg for eight seconds. "It’s incredibly painful, but my fingers are strong and I am proud of my lift," the 48-year-old said about his record.

38.title: Rebranded McDonald's in Russia unveils new logo ahead of reopening
38.article_body: The company replacing McDonald's in Russia following its exit from the country has unveiled its new logo. The new logo features a circle and two lines, which are said to represent a burger and two french fries. The business, which was bought for an undisclosed sum by Alexander Govor, is yet to decide on a name for the chain.

39.title: Europe's biggest meat-eating dinosaur discovered on the Isle of Wight
39.article_body: Researchers have discovered fossils of a giant crocodile-faced, meat-eating dinosaur on the Isle of Wight thought to be the biggest dinosaur known in Europe. The 33-foot-long carnivore that lived around 125 million years ago could move quickly and had razor-sharp claws and rows of pointy teeth to munch anything it hunted down. Scientists have nicknamed it as White Rock spinosaurid.

40.title: Laptop, cash stolen from archer Abhishek Verma's wife's car in Delhi
40.article_body: A case has been registered after archer Abhishek Verma's wife's bag containing a laptop, some documents and cash over worth ₹1 lakh was stolen from an Audi car in Delhi's Rohini. Verma said his wife, who was on her way home from office, had parked her car in the area for shopping. The accused had allegedly broken the car's windowpane.

41.title: It was mineral water: Ayesha on Akshay spraying water on her from mouth in song
41.article_body: As her film 'Khiladi' completed 30 years of release, actress Ayesha Jhulka spoke about whether she was apprehensive about doing the shot where Akshay Kumar sprayed water on her from his mouth. Ayesha said, "Well, it was mineral water thrown on my face. So, it was okay." The shot was part of the song 'Kya Khabar Thi Jaana'.

42.title: Bhuvan Bam to make OTT debut with comedy-drama series 'Taaza Khabar'
42.article_body: YouTuber and actor Bhuvan Bam is all set to make his OTT debut with a comedy-drama series titled, 'Taaza Khabar'. Directed by Himank Gaur, the show also stars Shriya Pilgaonkar, JD Chakravarthy, Deven Bhojani, Prathamesh Parab, Nitya Mathur, Shilpa Shukla and Mithilesh Chaturvedi in pivotal roles. Bhuvan said, "I wholeheartedly hope the audience enjoys and cherishes this story."

43.title: 4th seed Sindhu enters quarter-finals of Indonesia Open 2022
43.article_body: Two-time Olympic medallist PV Sindhu entered the quarter-finals of the 2022 Indonesia Masters Super 500 badminton tournament on Thursday. The fourth seed defeated Gregoria Mariska Tunjung of Indonesia 23-21, 20-22, 21-11 in one hour 11 minutes in the second round. Sindhu will now face fifth seed Ratchanok Intanon, who beat unseeded Kirsty Gilmour 21-17, 19-21, 21-15, on Friday.

44.title: 11 vehicles vandalised in Pune's Janata Vasahat area, 5 detained
44.article_body: At least 11 vehicles were vandalised by unidentified persons in the Janata Vasahat area of Pune, police said. Police have registered a case and five persons have been detained in connection with the incident, an officer said. The incident seems to be a fallout of a gang rivalry, the officer added.

45.title: Everyone shuts up when Messi talks, even Argentina's Prez: Martinez
45.article_body: Argentina goalkeeper Emiliano Martinez said "everyone" shuts up when Lionel Messi talks, even the President of Argentina. Messi won his first ever international trophy when Argentina defeated Brazil 1-0 in the Copa America 2021 final. It was the footballer's fourth Copa America final. Messi currently represents PSG in club football having previously played for Barcelona.

46.title: 'Brazil Prez doesn't respect democracy,' says Hulk actor, Brazil Prez replies
46.article_body: Hulk actor Mark Ruffalo criticised Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro ahead of US President Joe Biden's meeting with Bolsonaro, saying, "The man you're meeting...does not respect democracy." Ruffalo added, "[He] consistently threatens a coup." Bolsonaro responded, "I'm sure you've never read the Brazilian Constitution...it's nothing like the complicated Hulk scripts you've to memorise: "AHGFRR"."

47.title: Villagers set 2 men on fire for raping a girl in Jharkhand; 1 dead
47.article_body: Two men, aged 19 and 22, were set ablaze by villagers in Jharkhand's Gumla for allegedly abducting and raping a girl, following which one of the accused succumbed to his injuries, police said. After the incident, the girl's neighbours had become "very violent", a police officer said. "We are in the process of registering two FIRs," the police officer added.

48.title: An actor can't showcase talent without opportunities: Shekhar Suman
48.article_body: Actor Shekhar Suman, while talking about his son Adhyayan's career, said he does not agree with the term 'nepotism'. "I think...time and opportunities matter. An actor is nothing without opportunities," he said, adding that an actor can't showcase their talent if they don't get appropriate opportunities. "It's like a swimmer is asked to swim in...pool without water," Shekhar said.

49.title: Five new countries elected to UN Security Council
49.article_body: The UN General Assembly on Thursday elected Ecuador, Japan, Malta, Mozambique and Switzerland as non-permanent members of the Security Council. Non-permanent members are elected for a two-year term, with the newly-elected members' terms set to begin in January 2023. The United Nations Security Council (UNSC) is composed of 15 members, five permanent and 10 non-permanent.

50.title: Pune police arrest 12 persons for gambling, seize ₹2 lakh-items
50.article_body: Pune police's social security cell arrested 12 people for gambling following raids at various spots and seized materials worth over ₹2 lakh, according to officials. As per police, a total of 22 raids have been conducted and 175 people arrested so far this year. Moreover, a police officer said that mobile gambling has emerged as a "new form of gambling".

51.title: Ex-MP Divya Spandana files complaint over lewd comments in B'luru
51.article_body: Former MP Divya Spandana on Thursday filed a complaint with Bengaluru cyber crime police over alleged lewd comments made against her on social media. Spandana "herself came to...station and registered a complaint," a police officer said. In May, Spandana, who previously also served as Congress' social media head, claimed that Karnataka Congress leadership asked leaders and volunteers to troll her.

52.title: Woman, 17-yr-old son arrested for killing her husband in Delhi
52.article_body: A woman and her 17-year-old son were arrested for allegedly stabbing her husband to death in Delhi's Jwalapuri area. The accused used a pair of scissors and a sharp weapon for murder as she was allegedly fed up with the deceased's frequent domestic abuse. Notably, the accused broke down and admitted to murdering her husband during interrogation, police said.

53.title: Massive protest held at Delhi's Jama Masjid over BJP leaders' remarks on Prophet
53.article_body: A massive protest broke out at Delhi's Jama Masjid on Friday against alleged inflammatory remarks by suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma and expelled head of Delhi BJP's media unit Naveen Kumar Jindal on Prophet Muhammad. According to Jama Masjid's Shahi Imam, no call for protest was given by the mosque committee. Police said they've removed the protestors from the area.

54.title: PFA reveals Premier League Team of the Year, Cristiano Ronaldo included
54.article_body: The Professional Footballers' Association (PFA) revealed the Premier League Team of the Year, which includes Manchester United's Cristiano Ronaldo. Apart from Ronaldo, the team includes Liverpool's Alisson, Virgil van Dijk, Trent Alexander-Arnold, Thiago, Mo Salah and Sadio Mané. It also includes Manchester City's João Cancelo, Kevin De Bruyne and Bernardo Silva, and Chelsea's Antonio Rüdiger.

55.title: 30 held in Delhi for protesting against Owaisi's name in FIR
55.article_body: Delhi Police on Friday arrested 30 persons on several charges, including rioting, after they protested against the inclusion of AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi's name in an FIR over alleged hate speech. The protestors gathered outside Delhi's Parliament Street Police Station. Delhi Police named Owaisi and Hindutva leader Yati Narsinghanand in an FIR registered over alleged inflammatory remarks.

56.title: Angelina Jolie to direct 'Eternals' co-star Salma Hayek in 'Without Blood'
56.article_body: Angelina Jolie is set to direct her 'Eternals' co-star Salma Hayek in her upcoming film 'Without Blood'. According to reports, the filming will take place in regions of southern Italy, as well as in Rome. Written and produced by Jolie, 'Without Blood' is an adaptation of Alessandro Baricco's novel by the same name. The film also features Demián Bichir.

57.title: I'd signed 75 films when I was 21, Dilip Kumar said 'drop 25 of them': Govinda
57.article_body: Actor Govinda has revealed that when he was 21, he had signed 75 films. He added that Dilip Kumar told him to drop 25 films. "When I told him...I'd already spent...signing amount, he said...God will ensure...I earn the money back, but that I must return...And he was right, I was falling ill...I once didn't sleep for 16 days," Govinda said.

58.title: Wind from N Korea could be carrying COVID, close your windows: Chinese city to people
58.article_body: Chinese authorities in the city of Dandong have asked people to close their windows, with officials saying that the wind from North Korea could be carrying COVID-19, according to a report by Vice News. The city of Dandong borders North Korea and is separated by a river that runs hundreds of metres wide.

59.title: Sensex falls over 1,000 points to trade below 55,000; Nifty slips below 16,300
59.article_body: Sensex fell over 1,000 points to trade at 54,299 and Nifty was lower by 284 points or 1.73% at 16,214.45 during Friday's intraday trade. Shares of Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC), plunged 1.77% to hit an all-time intraday low of ₹709.20. Notably, Kotak Mahindra Bank was the top Nifty loser as the stock dropped 3.44% to ₹1,801.05.

60.title: Assam teacher sentenced to 6 yrs in prison for sexually abusing minor
60.article_body: A local court in Assam convicted a teacher for sexually abusing a minor girl and sentenced him to six years of imprisonment. It also imposed a fine of ₹10,000 on the convict. The family members of the girl had lodged a complaint with the police in February this year following the incident that took place last year.

61.title: 5 people dead, 1 injured as car falls into gorge in Nainital
61.article_body: Five people died after a car fell into a gorge in Nainital's Okhalkanda area on Thursday. Only the driver is undergoing treatment while the remaining passengers died on the spot, police said. Notably, the car was going to Gurdwara Reetha Sahib from Haldwani. Earlier on Thursday, five people died after a vehicle fell into a gorge in Tehri Garhwal, Uttarakhand.

62.title: $100 billion wiped off world's largest chipmaker's market value this year
62.article_body: About $100 billion has been wiped off the market value of the world's largest chipmaker Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC) this year. The $475 billion company accounts for about 27% of Taiwan's entire equity market value, as per Bloomberg. Despite having shed one-tenth of its share value, TSMC shares are expected to surge 50% in 12 months, as per analysts.

63.title: White US policeman charged with murder of 26-year-old black motorist
63.article_body: A US police officer has been charged with murder for the fatal shooting of a Black motorist during an altercation after a traffic stop in April. Police had released videos from the incident, one of which showed policeman Christopher Schurr lying on top of the 26-year-old Congolese refugee, Patrick Lyoya, and then appearing to shoot him in the head.

64.title: Deepika visits Tirupati temple with family on father's b'day, pics surface
64.article_body: Deepika Padukone visited Sri Venkateswara Swamy Vaari temple in Tirupati on Friday, on the occasion of her father Prakash Padukone's 67th birthday. The actress was accompanied by her sister Anisha and her parents, Prakash and Ujjala Padukone. Deepika and her family had earlier visited the Tirupati temple on her first wedding anniversary.

65.title: There could be mini COVID-19 waves every 4-6 months: WHO Chief Scientist
65.article_body: As COVID-19 cases are on a rise across India, WHO Chief Scientist Dr Soumya Swaminathan has said that it could be the start of a mini wave. "The sub-variants that are emerging are more transmissible than...original Omicron BA.1 and...there's likelihood of waning immunity," she said. "There could be mini waves every four-six months...hence...it's important to...track the variant," she added.

66.title: Quite often you bluff yourself that you're not tired: Ponting on Kohli
66.article_body: Sharing his opinion on Virat Kohli, former Australia captain Ricky Ponting said, "One thing I do know...is that quite often you bluff yourself as a player that you are not actually tired." "It's not until you actually stop and have a couple of days [that] you realise how tired...you are...[This] might be exactly where Kohli is at now," added Ponting.

67.title: It's sexist: Johnny Depp's lawyer Camille dismisses rumours of dating the actor
67.article_body: Johnny Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez has dismissed rumours claiming she is dating the actor. In an interview, Vasquez revealed that she has a boyfriend and regarding the rumours said, "It's sexist...I guess it comes with the territory of being a woman just doing her job." She also said, "I'm Cuban and Colombian...I hug everyone. And I'm not ashamed about that."

68.title: Strange creature standing on 2 legs spotted outside US zoo; pic goes viral
68.article_body: A picture of a strange creature standing on two legs outside a zoo in US' Texas has gone viral on social media. The picture was shared on City of Amarillo's official Facebook page. "The Amarillo Zoo captured a strange image outside the zoo in the dark and early morning hours of May 21," it said.

69.title: Amazon may not compete for IPL broadcast rights with Reliance, Disney: Report
69.article_body: Amazon is planning to withdraw its candidature from competing with companies like The Walt Disney Company and Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries at the e-auction for the rights to telecast IPL matches to be held between 2023 and 2027, as per a report. The cost to acquire these rights could reportedly be up to $7.7 billion (around ₹60,000 crore).

70.title: Russia-occupied Mariupol at risk of cholera outbreak: UK
70.article_body: The UK Defence Ministry said that Russia is struggling to provide basic public services to the population in Russian-occupied territories in Ukraine. There is likely a critical shortage of medicines in Kherson, while Mariupol is at risk of a major cholera outbreak, the ministry added. Isolated cases of cholera have been reported in Mariupol since May, it further said.

71.title: Fitch revises India's sovereign rating outlook to Stable from Negative
71.article_body: Fitch Ratings has revised the outlook on India's sovereign rating to Stable from Negative and has affirmed the rating at 'BBB-'. "The Outlook revision reflects our view that downside risks to medium-term growth have diminished due to India's rapid economic recovery,” it said. It cut economic growth forecast to 7.8% for FY23 from the 8.5% prediction it made in March.

72.title: Hyderabad police arrest BJP leader over skit against Telangana CM
72.article_body: Hyderabad's Hayathnagar police on Friday arrested BJP leader Jitta Balakrishna Reddy over an alleged skit that made fun of Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao. An officer said that during the skit, actors used derogatory comments, made personal attacks and depicted Rao as a "boozer, cheater etc." State BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar was also booked in the matter.

73.title: India's electricity demand reaches all-time high of 2,10,793 MW
73.article_body: As per the Ministry of Power, the all India electricity demand met on June 9 clocked an all-time high of 2,10,793 MW. "The rising power demand reflects the economic growth in the country post the pandemic. The ongoing heatwave in northwest India is also a reason for the spike in demand," the ministry said.

74.title: SC dismisses pleas seeking special round of counselling in NEET-PG 2021
74.article_body: Supreme Court has dismissed pleas seeking a special stray round of counselling for vacant seats in NEET-PG 2021 All India Quota. As many as 1,456 seats were vacant after the May 7 counselling.  The quality of medical education cannot be compromised, which affects public health, SC said. The decision not to conduct fresh counselling was not arbitrary, it added.

75.title: Got De Villiers out whenever I faced him, could dismiss easily: Akhtar
75.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said he managed to dismiss AB de Villiers whenever he faced him, adding he even felt he could dismiss De Villiers "easily" at times. "When he came for [the] IPL, he tried to play the pull shot but I knew...he would be late because there was a lot of pace [in] my delivery," stated Akhtar.

76.title: Cyberabad Police warn people of fraudsters targeting verified Twitter users
76.article_body: The Cyberabad Police on Thursday warned people of fraudsters targeting newly verified profiles on Twitter. "Messages come from accounts claiming to be Twitter support. Seek the submission of documents and related details," Cyberabad Police tweeted. It further asked people not to click on any links or documents as they might include malicious spam or phishing websites.

77.title: Mithali gave Indian women's cricket a template that thousands followed: Kaif
77.article_body: After Mithali Raj announced her retirement on Wednesday, former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif congratulated the 39-year-old batter on her 23-year-long career. "Mithali Raj gave Indian women's cricket a template that thousands of girls followed. Would love to see her in a position (of) power," Kaif tweeted. Notably, Raj made her ODI debut at the age of 16 against Ireland.

78.title: Army Major cuts wife's finger over dowry in UP's Meerut
78.article_body: The wife of an Army Major has accused her husband of cutting her finger over dowry in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut. The woman told police that her husband has been harassing her mentally and physically for dowry since their marriage in 2014. The accused is posted with the Corps of Electronics and Mechanical Engineers at 510 Army Base in Meerut.

79.title: Uber is recession resistant, doesn't see a need for job cuts: CEO Dara
79.article_body: Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi during an event said that the company is "recession resistant" and doesn't see a need for job cuts amid market volatility and technology companies opting for cost-cutting and slow hiring. Earlier in May, Khosrowshahi told his employees over an email that Uber will treat hiring as a 'privilege' while announcing a need for job cuts.

80.title: Jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi issued threat letter to Salman Khan: Mumbai Police
80.article_body: The Mumbai Police have said that jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi had issued threat letter to Salman Khan and his father Salim Khan. "Three people from his gang had come from Jalore, Rajasthan, to Mumbai to drop the letter and had met accused Saurabh Mahakal," they added. Their plan was to terrorise and extort money from them, the police stated.

81.title: RR share 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' meme after Rassie, Miller help SA defeat India
81.article_body: RR shared 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' meme after Rassie van der Dussen and David Miller helped South Africa defeat India in the first T20I. "Kabhi kabhi aisa kyun hota hai...ki apne paraye ho jaate hain (Why do sometimes our own become strangers?)" the meme read. Notably, Rassie is contracted to RR, while Miller played for RR in 2020 and 2021.

82.title: Thief hanging from railway bridge snatches mobile from moving train in Bihar
82.article_body: A video showing a thief hanging from a railway bridge snatching a mobile from a moving train in Bihar has gone viral on social media. According to local reports, the incident took place earlier this week. The incident happened on Rajendra Setu, the rail bridge connecting Patna and Begusarai, reports further said.

83.title: UN appeals for $47 mn for life-saving aid to 1.7 mn people in Sri Lanka
83.article_body: The UN and its partners have launched a joint Humanitarian Needs and Priorities Plan calling for $47.2 million to provide life-saving assistance between June and September to 1.7 million people worst-hit by the economic crisis in Sri Lanka. In total, nearly 5.7 million people need immediate life-saving assistance, UN said, adding, nearly 22% of Sri Lanka's population needs food assistance.

84.title: Rolex watch worn by prisoner during WWII 'great escape' sells for ₹1.4 crore in US
84.article_body: A Rolex watch worn by a British prisoner during the World War II "great escape" from the Nazi Stalag Luft III prisoner-of-war camp has sold for $189,000 (over ₹1.4 crore) at an auction in US. The watch was worn by Gerald Imeson on the night of March 24, 1944, when a group of Allied soldiers escaped.

85.title: Govt betraying country: Rahul Gandhi on Chinese activity near Ladakh
85.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday alleged that the Indian government is betraying the country by ignoring infrastructure build-up by China near the borders. His comments came after US General Charles A Flynn expressed concern over Chinese infrastructure coming up near eastern Ladakh, calling it "alarming". "China is building...foundations for hostile action in the future," Rahul tweeted.

86.title: China gives initial nod to revive Jack Ma-owned Ant's IPO: Report
86.article_body: China has given billionaire Jack Ma's Ant Group a tentative green light to revive its IPO, Reuters reported citing sources. Ant aims to file a preliminary prospectus for the share offering in Shanghai and Hong Kong as early as next month. However, Ant has said there was no plan to relaunch its IPO.

87.title: 3 undertrial prisoners escape Rajasthan jail using blankets; made hole in cell wall
87.article_body: As many as three undertrial prisoners, who were under judicial custody in different cases, escaped from Rajasthan's Banswara district jail on Thursday. "They jumped an inner boundary wall 12 feet tall...then the outer wall of 20 feet with the help of a rope they made with blankets," the jailer said. They made a hole in the wall of the cell.

88.title: People keep asking 'Why's he playing?': Wasim Akram on Pak's Hassan Ali
88.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said Pakistani pacer Hassan Ali starts trending on Twitter even before "he could bowl the second over of his spell", adding people keep enquiring over why he is playing. "Please stop criticising Hassan...Please give him some space," stated Akram. Hassan conceded 68 runs and went wicketless in Pakistan's first ODI against West Indies.

89.title: We didn't win West Bengal elections due to COVID-19: BJP chief JP Nadda
89.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Thursday said that his party didn't come to power in West Bengal as they failed to win the required number of seats in the 2021 Assembly elections because of COVID-19. "Due to...rise in COVID, BJP failed to campaign properly," Nadda said. "But there are more elections to come and BJP will win," he added.

90.title: Pune civic body to start night patrolling to check littering on highways
90.article_body: After receiving complaints from the residents, the Pune Municipal Corporation has decided to start night patrolling in order to monitor the dumping of garbage along the city's highways. The PMC will soon form patrolling teams and will take assistance from the police department, an official said. Notably, the residents can call on PMC's toll-free number to report such cases.

91.title: Women will come on Swayamvar for my name & fame: Mika Singh
91.article_body: Singer Mika Singh, speaking about the show 'Swayamvar - Mika Di Vohti', said, "All the girls coming on the show...know who I am and that I'm an established name." "They'll obviously come for my name, fame and there's nothing wrong with it," he added. "Even parents also look for...bride or groom who's well-settled...nobody wants their kids to marry...struggler," said Mika.

92.title: WB Class 12 board exam results declared; Adisha Deb Sharma emerges topper
92.article_body: West Bengal Council of Higher Secondary Education declared the Class 12 board exam results on Friday. Adisha Deb Sharma from Cooch Behar has emerged as the topper with 498 marks out of 500. The overall pass percentage this year has stood at 88.44%. A total of 7.4 lakh students registered for the West Bengal Class 12 board exams this year.

93.title: BharatPe founding member Nathani resigns, 3rd exit in a week: Report
93.article_body: BharatPe's founding member Satyam Nathani has resigned, making it the third exit in a week, Moneycontrol reported citing sources. Nathani's resignation comes days after Chief Revenue Officer Nishit Sharma and head of institutional debt Chandrima Dhar's reported exits. "Nathani plans to start his own venture after leaving BharatPe," a source was quoted as saying.

94.title: PMC issues notice to 3 eateries after fire at terrace restaurant
94.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) on Thursday issued notices to three restaurants and bars after a fire gutted a terrace restaurant in Aundh a day earlier. "When the restaurants cover the terrace or construct something, it's illegal," a PMC executive engineer said. The civic body is also checking fire brigade and building permissions for rooftop restaurants following the fire incident.

95.title: Wipro CEO becomes highest paid CEO in Indian IT sector with ₹79.6 cr pay in FY22
95.article_body: Wipro CEO Thierry Delaporte's annual salary for FY22 came to $10.5 million (₹79.6 crore), making him the highest paid CEO in India's IT industry. Delaporte's annual salary was ₹64.3 crore ($8.7 million) in the financial year 2020-21. Meanwhile, Infosys CEO Salil Parekh's pay was $10.2 million in FY22 and HCL's C Vijayakumar made $4.15 million during the same period.

96.title: Can't ask them to drop Rohit Sharma or KL Rahul and make me play: Ishan Kishan
96.article_body: Opener Ishan Kishan, who scored 76(48) against South Africa in the first T20I, said that he won't ask for opening spot when Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul are in the team. "I can't ask them to drop them and make me play. I will keep doing my thing...and I will give my best whenever I get my chance," he added.

97.title: Man gets 3 weeks bail to take care of pregnant live-in partner in Delhi
97.article_body: Delhi High Court granted interim bail for three weeks to a man to take care of his pregnant live-in partner. "Considering...except for her grandparents, who are in their nineties, there's no one to take care of the co-accused...applicant is admitted to interim bail," HC said. The couple had been booked for possession of fake identity cards of RAW and IB.

98.title: Arjun Kapoor shares childhood pic with Sonam on her b'day, pens note
98.article_body: Arjun Kapoor on Thursday took to Instagram to share a childhood picture with Sonam Kapoor on the latter's birthday. "This photo sums us up perfectly...you the bashful one and me the thinker," Arjun wrote, adding, "Times flown by...but we haven't changed just grown up I guess...from us being kids to you having one of your own now...always proud of you."

99.title: HIV-infected trio snatch chains, spend money on sex workers in B'luru; caught
99.article_body: Three HIV-infected chain snatchers who allegedly sold gold chains and spent the money on sex workers in Bengaluru and other luxuries have been caught, police said on Friday. The accused established physical relations with sex workers without informing the latter about being infected with HIV, as per the investigation. A search has been launched to identify affected women, police added.

100.title: 1st sharpshooter arrested in Sidhu Moosewala killing
100.article_body: Harkamal Ranu, one of the eight sharpshooters who allegedly opened fire on Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, was arrested by Punjab police on Friday. The arrest of Ranu, who belongs to Bathinda, was confirmed by his family. Moosewala was shot dead on May 29 in Punjab's Mansa district.

101.title: U'khand cricketers got ₹100 as daily allowance, board spent ₹35 lakh on bananas: Report
101.article_body: Uttarakhand cricketers have been given a daily allowance of ₹100 for the last 12 months despite it being around ₹1,500-₹2,000, as per a report. The state cricket board had reportedly spent ₹35 lakh on bananas and ₹22 lakh on water bottles for the financial year ending March 31, 2021. Uttarakhand recently lost in the Ranji Trophy quarter-final against Mumbai.

102.title: AIMIM to vote for MVA in RS polls in Maha to defeat BJP: AIMIM MP
102.article_body: AIMIM MP Imtiaz Jaleel has tweeted that the party will be voting for Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) in the Rajya Sabha elections in Maharashtra "to defeat BJP". However, he said that AIMIM's "political/ideological differences...will continue with Shiv Sena" which is part of the MVA. "We laid certain conditions related to the development of our MLAs' constituencies," he added.

103.title: Goa govt issues notice to hotels owned by Congress MLA Michael Lobo
103.article_body: The Goa government has issued show-cause notices to two properties owned by Congress MLA Michael Lobo. According to Town and Country Planning (TCP) Minister Vishwajit Rane, there have been gross violations of law in the construction of the two hotels in Calangute. The government has sought a reply within seven days failing which the illegal structures will be demolished.

104.title: When Shreyas dropped me, I knew I had to make India pay: Van der Dussen
104.article_body: South Africa's Rassie van der Dussen, who was his team's top-scorer with 75*(46) in the first T20I against India, said he knew he had to make India "pay" after being dropped by Shreyas Iyer. He scored 45 runs off next 15 balls which included 22 runs off Harshal Patel's third over. The batter scored at a strike rate of 163.04.

105.title: BJP should look after their house; we will win 3 RS seats: Ashok Gehlot
105.article_body: On the day of polling for the four Rajya Sabha seats from Rajasthan, CM Ashok Gehlot has said that Congress will win three Upper House seats. "We are winning comfortably and it's the BJP who should look after their house. The way they fielded another candidate (Independent candidate Subhash Chandra) was not liked by even their party MLAs," Gehlot said.

106.title: US military aircraft crashes in desert; 2nd incident in 2 days
106.article_body: A US Navy helicopter crashed on Thursday near the California desert site where a day earlier a Marine Osprey went down, killing all five people aboard. "All four...aircrew on board survived the crash and have been safely recovered," the US Navy said. The MH-60S Seahawk crashed while conducting a routine training flight from Naval Air Facility El Centro, it added.

107.title: Twitter tests new shopping feature 'Product Drops' on iOS devices in US
107.article_body: Twitter has announced that it is testing a shopping feature called 'Product Drops' on iOS devices in the US. With this feature, merchants will be able to tease and promote new product launches while shoppers will see a 'Remind me' button that will notify them of the product launch and provide all other relevant details about the item.

108.title: Thailand 1st Asian country to legalise marijuana consumption; smoking still banned
108.article_body: Thailand legalised the growing of marijuana and its consumption in food and drinks on Thursday, the first Asian country to do so. However, smoking pot is still against the law. Thailand, which has a tradition of using cannabis to relieve pain and fatigue, legalised medicinal marijuana in 2018.

109.title: Mumbai boy jumps in front of train after being asked to focus on studies
109.article_body: A 16-year-old boy was killed after he jumped in front of a train between Kandivali and Malad railway stations in Mumbai on Wednesday night. The police found a suicide note wherein the boy claimed that he was being pressured by his parents to concentrate on his studies. However, no case has been filed against the parents, a police officer said.

110.title: Disha Vakani will not return as Dayaben in 'Taarak...', confirms producer
110.article_body: Producer Asit Kumarr Modi has confirmed that Disha Vakani will not return as Dayaben to his show 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah'. "Dayaben, the character, is all set to return but it's not Disha Vakani. Auditions for Disha's replacement are on and there will be a new actress coming in as Dayaben soon," Asit said in an interview.

111.title: Police busts insurance fraud gang in Noida, 4 held
111.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police have busted an insurance fraud gang which was claiming money from victims on the pretext of reviving the latter's lapsed insurance policies. The gang was operating from a commercial hub in Noida's Sector 18, police said. The four suspects, which include two women, are identified as Shobhit Gupta, Bharti Rajput, Islam Khan and Priti.

112.title: My diabolical plan: Musk on spoof article on Tesla cars forcibly taking staff to work
112.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk while replying to a spoof article that claimed Tesla employees' cars will now drive them to work against their will, said "My diabolical plan is coming together!" The spoof article was published by The Babylon Bee, a satire website. Earlier, Musk had told Tesla employees that remote work is no longer acceptable in the company.

113.title: BJP MLA's daughter misbehaves with police after her car stopped in Bengaluru
113.article_body: Karnataka BJP MLA Aravind Limbavali's daughter Renuka has been accused of misbehaving with the traffic police after her car was stopped and she was fined for a traffic rule violation in Bengaluru. "Do you know Aravind Limbavali? I am his daughter. That's all," she told the traffic police. Reportedly, she also manhandled the media persons who were recording the video.

114.title: We do not want to see another North Korean nuclear test: China
114.article_body: China's UN Ambassador said Beijing doesn't want to see North Korea carry out a new nuclear test. Last month, China vetoed a US-led bid to impose new UN sanctions on Pyongyang over recent missile launches. However, Zhang Jun warned against making presumptions about how China might react at UN if Pyongyang goes ahead with its first nuclear test since 2017.

115.title: Jan 6, 2021 US Capitol riots were part of 'attempted coup' by Donald Trump: Panel
115.article_body: The House panel investigating the January 6, 2021 US Capitol riots said, "January 6 was the culmination of an attempted coup...The violence was no accident. It was Donald Trump's last stand." "Trump summoned a violent mob," said Liz Cheney, the panel's vice chair. The panel has conducted more than 1,000 interviews with people connected to the siege.

116.title: Tesla cancels three online hiring events for China
116.article_body: Tesla has cancelled three online hiring events for China without a reason. The events were for positions in sales, R&D and its supply chain originally scheduled for June 16, 23 and 30. However, the firm is still allowing applicants' submissions for over 1,000 openings for roles such as aerodynamics engineers, supply chain managers and store managers.

117.title: Pant was frantic in powerplay, only 2 overs for Chahal a mistake: Nehra
117.article_body: Talking about the first T20I between India and South Africa, ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra said India's stand-in captain Rishabh Pant was "frantic" in the powerplay having used five bowlers. "It is very surprising...that a bowler like Yuzvendra Chahal only bowled two overs...Pant surely made a mistake over there," added Nehra. Pant scored 29 off 16 balls in the first T20I.

118.title: Upset with rumours of her affair, class 9 girl in UP kills self
118.article_body: Upset with rumours of her affair spread by three youths, a girl studying in class nine reportedly died by suicide in Anoopshahr area in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr. Police have booked three men, Tinku, Arun and Ravindra, who allegedly spread a rumour that the girl had an affair with Tinku. The accused had reportedly apologised to her at village panchayat earlier.

119.title: Rupee falls to record low against US dollar for 2nd day in a row, reaches 77.82
119.article_body: The Indian rupee fell 8 paise to an all-time low of 77.82 against the US dollar in opening trade on Friday. On Thursday, the rupee had hit the then all-time low of 77.81 before closing at 77.74. This comes amid sustained foreign capital outflows and elevated global crude oil prices.

120.title: Bridge washes away in Meghalaya amid heavy rain; video surfaces
120.article_body: A video of a bridge in Meghalaya's South Garo Hills being washed away amid heavy rain has surfaced online. This comes after India Meteorological Department warned of continuous heavy rainfall in the state from June 9 to June 13. Earlier, four people, including children, had died due to landslides caused by heavy rain in two separate incidents in the state.

121.title: Mobile internet suspended in Jaipur's Amber ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
121.article_body: Mobile internet services in Jaipur's Amber were suspended for 12 hours starting 9 pm on Thursday. The divisional commissioner issued the order citing a security threat to Congress and other supporting MLAs who are staying in the tehsil ahead of the Rajya Sabha polls. The MLAs staying at Hotel Leela will cast their vote at the assembly building on Friday.

122.title: Curfew imposed, internet suspended in J&K's Bhaderwah amid communal tension
122.article_body: Curfew has been imposed and internet services have been suspended in Bhaderwah in Jammu and Kashmir's Doda district amid communal tension after alleged inflammatory speeches were delivered from a mosque, officials said. The inflammatory speeches were made during a protest against the remarks against Prophet Muhammad. "Anyone who takes the law into their hands will not be spared," police said.

123.title: Registrations closing soon for Hero Vired & INSEAD’s management program
123.article_body: Edtech company Hero Vired has partnered with the top business school, INSEAD (FT Global MBA Ranking 2021), to offer a certificate program in Strategic Management & Business Essentials. The program begins on June 13 and will cater to mid-senior professionals, entrepreneurs, and senior leaders looking to upgrade their leadership skills. The program also offers a 5-day immersion at INSEAD, Paris.

124.title: Navjot Sidhu discharged from Chandigarh hospital, shifted back to Patiala jail
124.article_body: Former Punjab Pradesh Congress Committee (PPCC) chief Navjot Singh Sidhu was shifted back to Patiala central jail on Thursday evening after he was discharged from PGI Chandigarh. Sidhu was admitted to the hospital due to liver-related problems. Sidhu was last month sentenced to one year in jail over a 1988 road rage case that led to a man's death.

125.title: Delhi Police files FIR against perfume brand over 'obscene' ad
125.article_body: Delhi Police on Thursday filed an FIR against a perfume brand over an "obscene" advertisement following a complaint by Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chairperson Swati Maliwal. She alleged that the advertisement "clearly encourages toxic masculinity and gang-rape". Notably, the advertisement was earlier taken off air after directions by the Union Ministry of Information and Broadcasting.

126.title: Microsoft to scale down business in Russia, fires 400 employees
126.article_body: Microsoft has announced that it will "scale down" its business in Russia amid its invasion of Ukraine. As per a report, the company has fired 400 employees in Russia. A company spokesperson said that the decision was taken as "a result of the changes to the economic outlook" and its impact on Microsoft's business in Russia.

127.title: Had I been with Imran, it wouldn't be this bad: Miandad on Pakistan cricket
127.article_body: Talking about Pakistan cricket, ex-Pakistan captain Javed Miandad said, "Had I been with [ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan] then things wouldn't have been this bad." "I have no feud with [1992 World Cup-winning captain] Imran, I...told him not to abolish...departmental cricket but he did not listen to me," added Miandad. Miandad had earlier claimed that Imran has ruined cricket in Pakistan.

128.title: West unlikely to reject Russian energy for years: Putin
128.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said the West will not be able to completely stop using Russian energy resources over next few years. Nobody knows what might happen during those years, so Russian companies will not block off their oil wells, Putin added. Last month, the European Union agreed to cut 90% of Russian oil imports by year-end over Ukraine war.

129.title: Ivanka Trump says she doesn't believe her father's claims of fraud in 2020 election
129.article_body: Ivanka Trump has told a congressional panel investigating the January 2021 US Capitol riots that she doesn't believe her father Donald Trump's claims that the 2020 presidential election was stolen from him because of voting fraud. Ivanka said she accepted what ex-Attorney General Bill Barr told her father. Barr told Trump at the time that his claims had no merit.

130.title: Over 7,000 COVID-19 cases reported in India for 2nd day in row
130.article_body: India has reported over 7,000 new COVID-19 cases for second day in a row. According to the latest data by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, the country saw 7,584 cases in the last 24 hours. Active cases stand at 36,267, while the COVID-19 death toll in the country has risen to 5,24,747.

131.title: Hardik Pandya refuses single to Dinesh Karthik, fans react to viral video
131.article_body: All-rounder Hardik Pandya refused a single to Dinesh Karthik in India's last over in the first T20I against South Africa. "Denying a single to Dinesh Karthik, the finisher India picked for the match," a fan commented. "Hardik Pandya denying Dinesh Karthik the strike on the last ball as if DK is a tail-ender," wrote another.

132.title: Aamir used to play pranks & I used to run behind him: Ayesha on 'Jo Jeeta...'
132.article_body: Actress Ayesha Jhulka, while recalling working with Aamir Khan in 'Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikandar', said, "He played lots of pranks...He used to play pranks and then I used to run behind him." "We used to feel like school children on the sets," she added. "All the time, he'd only think of how he can do some mischief," Ayesha further said.

133.title: Moosewala’s fan kills self after watching his live bhog ceremony in Punjab
133.article_body: A 20-year-old fan of Sidhu Moosewala in Punjab's Dera Bassi reportedly died by suicide after watching the singer's live bhog ceremony. The deceased allegedly attempted suicide on Wednesday and was rushed to a local hospital, but doctors referred him to Chandigarh, where he died on Thursday morning. His parents told police their son was Moosewala's fan.

134.title: B'luru records 458 new COVID-19 cases; 100 more than a day before
134.article_body: Bengaluru on Thursday recorded 458 new coronavirus cases, which is 100 more cases than it recorded the day before, according to data from Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). The number of new coronavirus recoveries was 208, while the deaths remained at zero, the data showed. This comes after the BBMP made wearing masks mandatory in public places.

135.title: VHP seeks action against B'luru mosque where alleged terrorist stayed
135.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) on Thursday wrote a letter to Bengaluru City Police Commissioner Pratap Reddy seeking action against a mosque in Okalipuram where the alleged Hizbul Mujahideen terrorist Talib Hussain was staying. The complaint also asked police to collect information on terrorist activities in the mosque. Hussain had come to the city a year ago, according to police officials.

136.title: Facebook begins trading as Meta on Nasdaq; changes stock ticker symbol
136.article_body: After trading on Nasdaq as Facebook for a decade, the company began trading under the name 'Meta' on Thursday. This also led to a change in its stock ticker symbol to Meta, replacing the company's ticker symbol 'FB', which it had been using since its IPO in 2012. In October 2021, CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced the company's name change.

137.title: Made it look easy, put spinners under pressure: Bavuma on Kishan's 76(48)
137.article_body: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma said opener Ishan Kishan's 76 off 48 balls in the first T20I against his team was a proper batting display, adding he put their spinners under pressure. "He made it look easy," stated Bavuma. Kishan's 76 comprised 11 fours and three sixes at a strike rate of 158.33. South Africa beat India by seven wickets.

138.title: Male, female CISF constables found dead at their flats in Pune
138.article_body: A male and a female CISF constable posted at the Pune International Airport were found dead at their respective homes at Gurudwara Colony in Pune's Lohegaon area. The deceased female constable, identified as Asmita Das (30), was a native of Odisha while the deceased male constable, identified as Sanjay Kumar (30), was a native of Uttar Pradesh.

139.title: Hyderabad Police arrest 2 men for sexually assaulting minor sisters
139.article_body: Hyderabad's Chilkalguda Police on Thursday arrested two men for allegedly sexually assaulting two minor girls, both sisters, on the pretext of marriage. According to police, the accused had introduced themselves to the girls around two years ago and after developing intimacy, they sexually assaulted the victims. Both the accused have criminal records and are facing several cases, police added.

140.title: Over 6,200 people penalised for riding bikes without helmet in Mumbai
140.article_body: Mumbai Traffic Police on Thursday penalised 6,271 people for riding on motorbikes and pillion without a helmet. Earlier, the police had said that they shall start taking action against pillion riders if they are found riding without a helmet from Thursday. While 2,334 two-wheeler riders were penalised for not wearing helmet, 3,421 were fined for riding pillion without a helmet.

141.title: 3 killed after employee opens fire at manufacturing factory in US
141.article_body: An employee opened fire at a manufacturing factory in US' Maryland on Thursday, killing three coworkers and critically wounding another, authorities said. The 23-year-old suspect was wounded in an exchange of gunfire with a Maryland state trooper while trying to flee in a car. Reportedly, the fatal incident is the 254th mass shooting in the US this year.

142.title: 4 held for stealing cash, valuables from high court judge's house in Delhi
142.article_body: Delhi Police arrested four persons, including a woman, for allegedly stealing valuables and cash from the house of a high court judge in Greater Kailash-1. A total of ₹1.40 lakh in cash and jewellery were stolen, police said. The lock on the back door was found broken and the almirah on the first floor was found open, police added.

143.title: CNG price hiked by ₹2/kg in Pune to ₹82/kg in 6th hike in 3 months
143.article_body: The price of CNG was hiked in Pune by ₹2/kg from Thursday and will now be available for ₹82/kg, according to Maharashtra Natural Gas Limited. This is the sixth hike in the price of CNG in three months. The CNG price was last increased in May. However, the Piped Natural Gas (PNG) price remained the same at ₹46 per SCM.

144.title: Sonu helps 2.5-year-old girl with 4 legs & 4 arms undergo successful surgery, shares pics
144.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood took to Instagram to share pictures of Chaumukhi, a 2.5-year-old girl from Bihar, who was born with four legs and four arms. Sonu, in his post, revealed that Chaumukhi underwent a successful surgery and is ready to go back to her home. "Mine and Chaumukhi Kumari's journey was successful," Sonu Sood wrote.

145.title: Britney Spears' ex-husband Jason Alexander crashes her wedding with Sam Asghari, arrested
145.article_body: Singer Britney Spears' ex-husband Jason Alexander was arrested after he crashed her wedding with Sam Asghari, authorities said. Alexander had live-streamed his entry to the wedding. "She's my first wife, my only wife. I'm her first husband. I'm here to crash the wedding," he was heard saying. "I am livid by this outrageous, criminal intrusion," Spears' attorney Mathew Rosengart said.

146.title: What is Red Corner Notice which was issued against Brar who claimed Moosewala's killing?
146.article_body: The Interpol has issued a Red Corner Notice against Goldy Brar, who claimed responsibility for the killing of singer Sidhu Moosewala. According to Interpol, "A Red Corner Notice is a request to law enforcement worldwide to locate and provisionally arrest a person pending extradition, surrender, or similar legal action. A Red Corner Notice is not an international arrest warrant."

147.title: TikTok senior executive 'steps back' after saying 'firms shouldn't offer maternity leave'
147.article_body: A senior executive at TikTok has "stepped back" and said he "will take some time off" from his role after he told his staff that as a "capitalist", he didn't believe companies should offer paid maternity leave. Meanwhile, a TikTok spokesperson said, "We are investigating alleged statements and actions to determine whether there has been a breach of company policies."

148.title: Voting for 16 Rajya Sabha seats across four states to be held today
148.article_body: Voting for 16 Rajya Sabha seats across four states, Rajasthan, Haryana, Maharashtra and Karnataka will be held today. In Maharashtra, six Rajya Sabha seats are going to the polls. As many as five seats each from Rajasthan and Karnataka, and two from Haryana are also going to the polls. So far, 41 candidates have been elected unopposed.

149.title: Actress Rebel Wilson reveals she's in a same-sex relationship, shares pic with girlfriend
149.article_body: Actress Rebel Wilson shared an Instagram post on Thursday announcing her new same-sex relationship with sustainable clothing brand Lemon Ve Limon founder Ramona Agruma. "I thought I was searching for a Disney Prince...but maybe what I really needed all this time was a Disney Princess #loveislove," she wrote. "Happy Pride Rebel," an Instagram user commented on her post.

150.title: Pics show SUV being driven on Ladakh's sand dunes, couple fined ₹50,000
150.article_body: The Leh Police posted photos on Facebook, showing an SUV being driven on sand dunes in Hunder in Nubra Valley, Ladakh. "One tourist vehicle was found violating the SDM [sub-divisional magistrate] Nubra's direction...The couple from Jaipur were booked...and a bond of ₹50,000 was taken," wrote Leh Police. The police further requested tourists not to drive on sand dunes.

151.title: To our baby's mama: Anand Ahuja wishes wife Sonam Kapoor on b'day
151.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor, who will soon become a mother, celebrated her birthday today. Taking to Instagram, her husband Anand Ahuja shared a few photos of her and captioned them, "Happy Birthday to my best friend, my partner, my girlfriend, my wife, and this year our baby's mama...to the most special, insightful power @sonamkapoor."

152.title: You're braver than you give yourself credit for: Chhavi on Mahima's cancer battle
152.article_body: After Anupam Kher's video, Chhavi Mittal shared a post for actress Mahima Chaudhry on her breast cancer battle. Taking to Instagram, she wrote, "You're braver than you give yourself credit for. The scars that a cancer patient carries aren't the ones the world sees on...body but the ones the soul carries deep within...Your battle scars...will make you emerge even stronger."

153.title: Pics of potholes on Bengaluru-Mysuru road force authorities to start repair work
153.article_body: Visuals of vehicles struggling to traverse a potholed stretch on the Bengaluru-Mysuru road triggered outrage on social media. This has forced authorities to immediately start repair work. Biocon chief Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw had called it "shocking and shameful". Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike said the stretch isn't maintained by the civic body but the Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited.

154.title: Sweetest: Kartik shares video of child singing 'Bhool...' song while praying
154.article_body: Kartik Aaryan shared a video of a child on Instagram, where he is heard singing Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2's song 'Hare Ram Hare Krishna' while praying. In the video, the boy is seated inside a temple at home and he starts singing the song, following which a lady seated next to him sings it too. Captioning it, Kartik wrote, "Sweetest video."

155.title: Yoga uplifts the mind and body: Sonowal at Yoga Utsav in Arunachal
155.article_body: Joining Yoga Utsav in Arunachal Pradesh's Ziro Valley, Union Minister Sarbananda Sonowal said, "Yoga uplifts the mind and body. It re-energises our spirit, yet keeps us calm and composed." Yoga Utsav was organised as a part of 12-day countdown to International Day of Yoga, 2022. The Bhagavad Gita has captured the essence of Yoga beautifully, Sonowal added.

156.title: Interpol issues Red Corner Notice against Goldy Brar, suspect in Moosewala murder
156.article_body: Interpol has issued Red Corner Notice against Canada-based gangster Goldy Brar, also known as Satinderjeet Singh. Goldy Brar had allegedly claimed responsibility for singer Sidhu Moosewala's murder in a social media post. The notice mentioned that he is 28 years old and listed murder, criminal conspiracy and supply of illegal firearms and attempt to murder among charges against him.

157.title: AIMIM supporters protest over FIR filed against Owaisi, detained
157.article_body: AIMIM supporters staged a protest in Delhi after their party chief Asaduddin Owaisi was named in an FIR, police said, adding 33 protesters were detained. The Delhi Police has registered FIRs against Nupur Sharma, Naveen Kumar Jindal, Asaduddin Owaisi and Yati Narsinghanand for allegedly posting and sharing messages on social media against the maintenance of public tranquility, officials said.

158.title: 1 killed, 12 injured over land dispute in Assam's Kamrup, 4 held
158.article_body: Police said that one person was killed and 12 others were injured in a clash over a land dispute in Assam's Kamrup district. "We have arrested four persons in connection with the incident," Hitesh Roy, Kamrup Superintendent of Police said. According to the police, the two groups attacked each other with iron rods, sticks, and sharp weapons.

159.title: 3 foreigners fighting for Ukraine amid war sentenced to death
159.article_body: Two British citizens and a Moroccan, fighting on behalf of Ukraine amid Russia's ongoing military offensive, were sentenced to death by a court in Ukraine's breakaway region and self-proclaimed Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) on Thursday. The court convicted the persons of mercenary activities and terrorism. "This is a sham judgment with...no legitimacy," UK Foreign Secretary Liz Truss said.

160.title: HDFC hikes retail prime lending rate on housing loans by 50 bps
160.article_body: HDFC on Thursday hiked its retail prime lending rate, on which its adjustable-rate home loans are benchmarked, by 50 basis points with effect from June 10. This is the fourth time that HDFC has raised home loan rates in June, taking the month's total hike to 90 basis points. Kotak Mahindra Bank and ICICI Bank also hiked interest rates recently.

161.title: SA record their highest successful chase in T20Is, end India's 12-match winning streak
161.article_body: South Africa chased down a target of 212 in the first T20I against India to register their highest successful chase in T20I history. South Africa's previous highest successful T20I run chase had come on September 11, 2007, when they chased down a 206-run target against West Indies. With the win, South Africa ended India's record-equalling 12-match winning streak in T20Is.

162.title: BJP MLA's daughter in BMW stopped over rash driving in B'luru; seen yelling at police
162.article_body: A video shows BJP MLA Aravind Limbavali's daughter misbehaving with Bengaluru traffic policemen after they stopped her over traffic violation and reportedly fined her for rash driving. The MLA's daughter, who was driving a BMW car, could be seen yelling at the policemen. She also tried to slap away a journalist's camera and said, "Shut the camera off."

163.title: Punjab rolls out new excise policy, liquor prices to drop by 35-60%
163.article_body: Punjab Cabinet on Wednesday approved the state's new excise policy, allowing the sale of an unlimited quota of beer and Indian Made Foreign Liquor (IMFL). The move is expected to bring down liquor prices by 35-60% from July 1 onwards and curb smuggling of illegal liquor. Excise duty on IMFL, beer and imported foreign liquor has been kept at 1%.

164.title: Finland to build barriers on its border with Russia amid NATO bid
164.article_body: Finland plans to amend its border legislation to allow building of barriers along the country's border with Russia, the Finnish government said on Thursday. This comes amid Finland's recent bid to join NATO following Russia's military offensive against Ukraine. Finland shares a 1,300-km long border with Russia, which is marked with signs and plastic lines for most of the stretch.

165.title: Those with monkeypox symptoms should get tested: UP CM Adityanath
165.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has asked the health department to remain on alert in the wake of the rise in monkeypox cases across the globe and asked those with symptoms to get tested. The state hasn't reported a single case of the infection, however, the UP government has asked the departments to monitor people who are returning from abroad.

166.title: Sri Lanka seeks India, China & Middle East's help amid forex crisis
166.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa held a meeting with senior diplomats from India, China and the Middle East on Thursday and sought assistance amid the country's ongoing forex crisis. India has provided support worth over $3.5 billion while extending an additional $500 million credit line to the cash-strapped country. China has pledged aid worth approximately $74 million to Sri Lanka.

167.title: Which are the top 10 economies for FDIs as per UN?
167.article_body: India is among the top 10 economies for FDI inflows in 2021, ranking 7th after the US, China, Hong Kong, Singapore, Canada and Brazil, according to United Nations Conference on Trade and Development's latest World Investment Report. South Africa, Russia and Mexico rounded up the top 10 economies for FDI inflows in 2021.

168.title: SEBI lets off Tata Motors for concealing facts in 18-year-old case
168.article_body: SEBI has let off Tata Motors Limited (TML) with a warning to be "more careful" in its future dealings in the securities market. SEBI said adverse orders passed now may not practically serve any purpose for events accrued over 18 years ago. It was alleged that Tata Finance, which was merged with TML, concealed true and correct facts from investors.

169.title: BJP corporator, leader attacked with sticks, shot at in UP
169.article_body: A BJP corporator and her husband, who is a BJP leader, were allegedly assaulted by some miscreants with sticks, while they were returning home in UP's Prayagraj, police said on Thursday. The couple alleged the accused opened fire and snatched Ramkumar Yadav's chain while escaping. Rinki Yadav was assaulted when she tried to save her husband, the complainant said.

170.title: Vishal Bhardwaj's film 'Khufiya' is not a regular spy thriller: Tabu
170.article_body: Speaking about working with filmmaker Vishal Bhardwaj in 'Khufiya', actress Tabu said the film is Vishal's dear project, which was conceptualised long back but couldn't happen. "Then...pandemic happened, which is when it picked up again. We were casting for it during COVID-19. It's the world of intelligence [and] agents...but not like...regular spy thriller that [people have seen]," she added.

171.title: Kerala CM must reveal his income sources: BJP leader amid gold scam
171.article_body: Kerala BJP Vice President KS Radhakrishnan said CM Pinarayi Vijayan must reveal the sources of wealth accumulated by himself and his family members. His comment comes after the main accused in Kerala gold smuggling case alleged CM Pinarayi Vijayan, his wife and daughter's involvement in the case. "The CM has to explain each detail of the allegations...against him," Radhakrishnan added.

172.title: PM Modi has brought a new culture to political working: Nadda in WB
172.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda, who is on a two-day visit to West Bengal, said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi has brought a new culture to political working in the country. Criticising the ruling party TMC, Nadda said, "Condition of West Bengal right now is similar to what India was famous for several years ago, scams and corruption."

173.title: 3 arrested for murder of elderly couple in Kolkata
173.article_body: The Kolkata Police have arrested three persons in connection with the murder of an elderly couple, whose bodies were found on Monday in their house in Kolkata's Bhowanipore area, police said. "It was a pre-planned murder," Kolkata Police Commissioner Vineet Kumar Goyal said. "The mastermind, who is a distant relative of the couple, is still absconding," Goyal added.

174.title: Don't arm demilitarised islands: Turkish Prez Erdoğan tells Greece
174.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan has told Greece to demilitarise islands in Aegean Sea, which Turkey claims are being armed in violation of treaties that guarantee islands' unarmed status. Turkey further states that islands were ceded to Greece on the condition that they won't be militarised.
