349.title: Curious to see Tom Hanks' reaction to 'Laal Singh Chaddha': Aamir Khan
349.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan has said that he is "very curious" to see how Tom Hanks reacts to his upcoming film 'Laal Singh Chaddha', which is an official remake of Hanks' 1994 film 'Forrest Gump'. "'Forrest Gump' is an iconic film...Hanks is a wonderful actor," Aamir stated. 'Laal Singh Chaddha' also features Kareena Kapoor Khan and is directed by Advait Chandan.

350.title: Side chicks will leave me, jokes Arsenal's Partey on Islam conversion
350.article_body: Talking about his conversion to Islam, Arsenal midfielder Thomas Teye Partey jokingly said, "I know my side chicks will leave me but it's no problem." "I grew up with Muslims so...it's the same thing. I have a girl I love," added Partey. The former Atletico Madrid player has announced that he would like to be known as Yakubu.

351.title: Mob attacks 2 polling booths, burn ballot papers in Assam
351.article_body: A mob destroyed ballot boxes at two polling booths and burned ballot papers during a local election in Assam, said police. The violence reportedly erupted after people found out that the rubber stamp used in voting was missing. The police had to fire in the air to control the situation. Re-polling at the booths will be held on June 10.

352.title: Parents beg after hospital staffer allegedly asks for ₹50,000 for son's body in Bihar
352.article_body: Parents of a youth in Bihar were seen begging to collect money to get the mortal remains of their son from Sadar Hospital after a hospital employee allegedly asked for ₹50,000 to release the body. "We're poor people, how can we pay this amount?" the deceased's father said. "Action will be taken if any employee is found guilty," official said.

353.title: Adivi starts Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan fund for CDS, NDA aspirants
353.article_body: Actor Adivi Sesh has announced a fund in the name of Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan. The fund will provide guidance, training and funding for CDS (Combined Defence Services examination) and NDA (National Defence Academy) aspirants across the country. "I'm going to start the fund and will incorporate the help of some more friends as well as actors," Adivi stated.

354.title: 3 PFI activists arrested over Kanpur violence, 54 arrests made so far
354.article_body: UP Police arrested three Popular Front of India (PFI) activists in connection with Kanpur violence. A total of 54 arrests have been made, police said. The three activists were previously arrested during anti-CAA protests in 2019, Kanpur Police Commissioner Vijay Singh Meena added. Violence broke out in Kanpur on Friday following former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad.

355.title: US House votes to raise age to buy semi-automatic weapons to 21
355.article_body: The US House of Representatives has passed a bill seeking to raise the minimum age to buy semi-automatic weapons from 18 years to 21. The bill, passed by 223-204 votes, also calls for banning sale of ammunition magazines that can carry over 15 rounds. This comes days after deadly shooting incidents in Texas, New York and Oklahoma.

356.title: Had no film sets, shot at live locations; was challenging: 'Khuda...' director
356.article_body: Faruk Kabir, director of 'Khuda Haafiz Chapter 2: Agni Pariksha', said that the team shot for the movie at live locations. "We did face a lot of challenges...there were no sets. The film has been shot very honestly without any gimmickry. That's always a challenging task," he said, adding that there was no body double for actor Vidyut Jammwal.

357.title: CISF constable found dead at rented apartment; suicide suspected
357.article_body: A 30-year-old Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) constable posted at the Pune International Airport was found dead at his rented apartment in Pune. "Primary probe points to it being a case of suicide. We've launched a probe into the sequence of events leading to...death and the reason for him taking the extreme step," senior police inspector Bharat Jadhav said.

358.title: Hrithik loved the original, was 1st to call us: 'Vikram...' co-maker
358.article_body: 'Vikram Vedha' co-director Gayatri revealed that Hrithik Roshan loved the original Tamil film, which featured R Madhavan and Vijay Sethupathi. "He was the first actor to call us after its release...we were at a wedding at that time," she added. Gayatri further stated Hrithik is "extremely down to earth". "If we didn't agree, he didn't have a problem," she added.

359.title: What is Kejriwal's compulsion to save Satyendar Jain?: Anurag Thakur
359.article_body: After Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain was arrested by ED in an alleged money laundering case, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal is enacting "drama" over ED’s action. "The charges are very serious and one wonders what is Kejriwal's compulsion in saving Satyendar Jain...Will you only make false allegations to demoralise the investigating agencies?" Thakur asked.

360.title: BSF fires at drone near international border in J&K's Arnia
360.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) troops fired at a drone spotted near the international border in Jammu and Kashmir's Arnia sector on Thursday morning. The drone that was flying at a height of around 300 metres returned back due to the firing, the BSF said. Officials said that the drone activity was from Pakistan.

361.title: I learnt the meaning, value of dal, roti at a young age: Suniel Shetty
361.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty said he learnt the meaning and value of dal and roti at a young age after being introduced to his father's restaurant business when he was 14 years old. "If we show good direction...we will come up with a genius," added Suniel. "I believe...[the] next Elon Musk and Bill Gates should come from India," stated Suniel.

362.title: Hindutvadis should know Islam rejects terrorism: Owaisi on Al-Qaeda's threat
362.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said "Hindutvadis" should know that Islam rejects terrorism. His statement came after Al-Qaeda in Indian Subcontinent (AQIS) threatened to carry out suicide attacks in Delhi, Mumbai, Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat. "The name of our Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) is exalted and does not need terrorists like Al-Qaeda to defend it," Owaisi tweeted.

363.title: 1 dead, 18 injured after building collapses in Mumbai's Shastri Nagar
363.article_body: One person died while 18 others were injured after a two-storey residential building collapsed in Mumbai's Shastri Nagar, ANI reported. One of the injured persons is undergoing treatment, while others have been discharged, it added. The incident occurred at around 12:15 am on Thursday, said Manjunath Singe, DCP Mumbai Police. "All of them are labourers from Bihar," he added.

364.title: Domestic violence doesn't have a gender: Johnny Depp's lawyer on criticism of verdict
364.article_body: On being asked about victims' advocate groups claiming that Johnny Depp's defamation trial victory against his ex-wife Amber Heard is a "blow" to the #MeToo movement, Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez said, "We encourage any victim to come forward." She added, "Domestic violence doesn't have a gender." "The verdict speaks for itself, the facts are what they are," she further stated.

365.title: Delhi Police file FIR against Nupur Sharma, Naveen Jindal, Saba Naqvi for spreading hate
365.article_body: Delhi Police have registered an FIR against Naveen Kumar Jindal, the expelled head of Delhi BJP's media unit, journalist Saba Naqvi and others for allegedly spreading messages of hate and inciting various groups, according to DCP (IFSO) KPS Malhotra. A second FIR was registered under similar sections against suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma and other social media users, police said.

366.title: This was never about money: Depp's lawyer on if he'll forego $10mn payout from Heard
366.article_body: On being asked if Johnny Depp will forego the over $10 million payout from Amber Heard, his lawyer said, "This was never about money for Depp. This was about restoring his reputation, and he's done that." Depp had sued Heard, claiming she defamed him when she published a Washington Post op-ed where she described herself as victim of domestic violence.

367.title: 6 Thai policemen get life sentences for torturing man to death
367.article_body: Six policemen were sentenced to life imprisonment for torturing a 24-year-old drug suspect to death during interrogation in Thailand. The officers were arrested after a video of the interrogation went viral last year. The video showed the suspect's head wrapped with seven plastic bags while being questioned. The officers also tried to extort $60,000 from the man.

368.title: As an actor, I'm getting my due after 20 years: Panchayat actor Faisal
368.article_body: 'Panchayat' actor Faisal Malik said he is getting his due after 20 years as an actor, adding his phone hasn't stopped ringing since 'Panchayat' started streaming. "This time, the pressure was huge...I used to sit alone for hours for four-five days," added Faisal. "Earlier I struggled due to not having work, now there is fear with projects available," stated Faisal.

369.title: Pune metro station features in Jawan teaser, official says 'open to offers'
369.article_body: Pune Metro Rail on Wednesday announced on Twitter that its Sant Tukaram Nagar metro station has featured in actor Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming movie 'Jawan'. "No other filmmakers, after the shooting of Shah Rukh Khan's movie, have approached Maha Metro for film shooting purposes but we are open for such offers in future," a Maha Metro official said.

370.title: About 20,000 meritorious students in Himachal to get laptops
370.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur on Wednesday launched a laptop distribution programme under the Srinivasa Ramanujan Student Digital Scheme to provide free laptops to about 20,000 meritorious students in the state. The government has spent ₹83 crore on the initiative. The CM said this move would motivate other students to excel in academics and win a laptop.

371.title: SP MLC booked for remarks against Lord Shiva, Shivling in UP
371.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader and UP MLC Lal Bihari Yadav has been booked for allegedly making offensive remarks against Lord Shiva and Shivling. The action was taken by police based on a complaint from Bajrang Dal workers, who alleged that Yadav's comments hurt religious sentiments. This comes after claims of a Shivling being found in Gyanvapi Mosque premises were made.

372.title: India reports 7,240 new COVID-19 cases, nearly 40% jump for 2nd straight day
372.article_body: India has reported 7,240 COVID-19 cases, 3,591 recoveries, and 8 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 5,233 COVID-19 cases and 7 deaths. Active cases in India increased to 32,498, while the death toll reached 5,24,723.

373.title: Switch over to e-offices completely by June 30: Delhi govt to all depts
373.article_body: Arvind Kejriwal-led Delhi government has asked all its departments to switch over to e-offices completely by June 30. All departments have been asked to put the requisite infrastructure in place by June 20, as per the official statement. The departments have also been directed to set up a central record unit, equipped with high-speed scanners, computers and internet connectivity.

374.title: Delhi Metro services delayed on Blue Line, 3rd incident in past 4 days
374.article_body: Train services on Delhi Metro's Blue Line, running between Dwarka Sector-21 and Vaishali and Noida Electronic City, were delayed on Thursday morning, the DMRC said. According to DMRC, an over-head electrification wire has been damaged, which is causing the delay. Notably, this is the third incident in past four days when Blue Line services have been affected.

375.title: Missed opportunity to learn from Aamir Khan during Sarfarosh: Sonali
375.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre recalled working with Aamir Khan in 'Sarfarosh' and stated that she "enjoyed it". "I missed the opportunity to consciously learn from Aamir during 'Sarfarosh'," she added. The film also featured Naseeruddin Shah and was directed by John Matthew Matthan. Sonali, talking about OTT platforms, said, "If OTT platforms wouldn't have come, we wouldn't have got second innings."

376.title: Working with Abhishek should happen; priority is still family, child: Aishwarya
376.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Rai, while speaking about working with husband and actor Abhishek Bachchan again, said, "It should happen." She also said that her family and her daughter, Aaradhya, continue to remain her priority. "I braved and stepped out to complete Mani sir's 'Ponniyin Selvan: I', but that doesn't change my focus for my family and Aaradhya," she added.

377.title: Karnataka reports 376 new COVID-19 cases; 358 in Bengaluru alone
377.article_body: Karnataka on Wednesday reported 376 new COVID-19 cases, out of which 358 were reported in Bengaluru alone. The city also reported 222 recoveries the same day, the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) data showed. With the new infections, the active COVID-19 cases in Bengaluru have risen to 2,526. The positivity rate in the city now stands at 2.01%.

378.title: Applications for Scaler’s Data Science Program soar by 200%: Scaler
378.article_body: Scaler shares that since they have opened doors to non-coders for its Data Science program, demand has doubled with more than 30,000 applications received in May alone. The program comes with two specializations depending on the learner's background. Non-coders can upskill with Analytics while experienced professionals can deep dive into coding with Machine Learning specialization, stated Scaler.

379.title: We need US General to call out Chinese activities near Ladakh: Owaisi
379.article_body: After a US General called Chinese build-up near Ladakh alarming, AIMIM's Asaduddin Owaisi said it should shame the government that a foreigner has to say it. "We need US General to tell us that the situation in Ladakh from the Chinese preparations and activities is 'alarming' and 'eye-opening' because our vocal PM has forgotten how to pronounce China," he tweeted.

380.title: Hyd gang-rape case accused Saduddin Malik sent to 3-day police custody
380.article_body: A Nampally court in Telangana sent Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills gang-rape case accused Saduddin Malik to three-day police custody till June 11. Notably, Malik is the only major among the six accused who have been arrested. A 17-year-old girl was allegedly gang-raped when she was returning home after a party in the Jubilee Hills area on May 28.

381.title: Which are the world's 20 best universities as per latest rankings?
381.article_body: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) was ranked the world's best university for the 11th year in a row in the latest rankings by global higher education analysts Quacquarelli Symonds (QS). Apart from MIT, eight other US universities made it to the top 20. UK's University of Cambridge was ranked second. Switzerland's ETH Zurich was ranked ninth.

382.title: Iran raises concern over Prophet remark with India, NSA Ajit Doval assures action
382.article_body: Iran's Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian, who's on a visit to India, raised the controversial remarks against Prophet Muhammad by two former BJP leaders with NSA Ajit Doval. Doval noted that the people involved "will be dealt with at the level of the government and related agencies in a way that is a lesson to others", according to Iran's Foreign Ministry.

383.title: No country except India is providing money for fuel: Sri Lanka amid economic crisis
383.article_body: Urging IMF to "expedite" its assistance programme to Sri Lanka, the country's Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said that no country except India is providing money for fuel amid the economic crisis. Stating that India cannot go on providing aid to Sri Lanka, Wickremesinghe further said, "Our Indian credit line is now nearing its end. We are talking about extending it."

384.title: Which are the top Indian institutes in latest world university rankings?
384.article_body: Indian Institute of Science (IISc) in Bengaluru emerged as the topmost Indian institute, ranking at the 155th spot, in the QS World University Rankings 2023.It is followed by IIT Bombay (172), IIT Delhi (174), IIT Madras (250), IIT Kanpur (264), IIT Kharagpur (270), IIT Roorkee (369), IIT Guwahati (384) and IIT Indore (396). Delhi University comes next on the list.

385.title: Fire breaks out at building in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar market, 80 rescued
385.article_body: A fire broke out in the basement of a commercial building in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar market on Wednesday, officials said. At least 80 people were rescued safely by fire personnel from three floors. Notably, the building houses a private bank on the ground and first floors, and a private company on the second and third floors.

386.title: Fire breaks out in evidence room of police station in Delhi, probe on
386.article_body: A fire broke out in 'malkhana' or evidence room of Delhi's Mandawali police station on Wednesday night. Reports said 10 fire tenders were rushed to the spot and the fire was brought under control late at night. No casualties were reported in the incident. Police said that some property was damaged in the fire and a probe has been initiated.

387.title: Famous Afghan model arrested by Taliban for disrespecting Islam; video surfaces
387.article_body: The Taliban have arrested a famous Afghan fashion model and three of his colleagues, accusing them of disrespecting Islam and the Quran. Ajmal Haqiqi appeared handcuffed in videos posted on Twitter by the Taliban intelligence agency on Tuesday. In a viral video, Haqiqi was seen laughing as his colleague Ghulam Sakhi recited verses of Quran in a comical voice.

388.title: Couldn't go to Switzerland for 'Dilwale..', SRK, Aditya still remind me: Farah
388.article_body: Choreographer Farah Khan said after late choreographer Saroj Khan refused to work on songs of 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge', filmmaker Aditya Chopra and actor Shah Rukh Khan asked her to fly to Switzerland immediately. She said she could not go due to another ongoing project. Farah added that Chopra and Khan remind her of her refusal even today.

389.title: Haven't forgotten: Maha CM on renaming Aurangabad as Sambhaji Nagar
389.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray said that he has not forgotten his late father Balasaheb Thackeray's promise of renaming Aurangabad as Sambhaji Nagar and said, "We will change it." "Hindutva is in our every breath," Uddhav Thackeray added. Criticising BJP in a rally in Aurangabad, he said, "If you have the courage then go and recite Hanuman Chalisa in Kashmir."

390.title: They work to spread violence: RSS leader on Al-Qaeda's threat
390.article_body: RSS leader Indresh Kumar said organisations like terror outfit Al-Qaeda "work to spread violence", after Al-Qaeda in Indian Subcontinent (AQIS) threatened to carry out suicide attacks in Delhi, Mumbai, Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat. He said, "Such an attitude is anti-Khuda, anti-Islam, anti-Muhammad and anti-humanity." The threat came after ex-BJP leaders' remarks against Prophet Muhammad.

391.title: 3 killed, 7 injured as shop collapses in Rajasthan's Udaipur
391.article_body: Police said three labourers were killed and seven others were injured after a shop collapsed when digging work was underway near an under-construction shop in Rajasthan's Udaipur district. Police added that the adjoining shop collapsed, leaving three labourers identified as Nilesh Menaria, Bhavesh Tamboli and Jaspal Singh dead. The injured are being treated, the police added.

392.title: Arhaan was in shock after my accident, he didn't believe anyone: Malaika
392.article_body: Malaika Arora recalled how her son Arhaan was in a "shock" after he came to know about her car accident. "He had no clue of the extent of damage that I'd suffered. He only wanted to be sure that I was fine," she added. "Although he was told everything about my surgery and recovery, he didn't believe anyone," she said.

393.title: Working with Farhan was amazing, he's fascinating: Ms Marvel actress Iman
393.article_body: Speaking about working with Farhan Akhtar in Ms Marvel, actress Iman Vellani said,  "My experience working with Farhan was amazing...On set, we'd have quiet moments and he'd just be telling me stories about going sky-diving, what it's like filming...movies." "I find him...a fascinating person...It's crazy that I grew up watching him and now I'm working with him," she added.

394.title: PM needs to step in if he wants to stop this poison: Naseeruddin on Prophet remark
394.article_body: Naseeruddin Shah expressed his resentment over derogatory remarks on Prophet Muhammad by former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma. "I wish...the hatemongers whom...PM seems to follow on Twitter, he does something to silence them," the actor told NDTV. "I think this is the time when he needs to step in if he really wants to stop this poison from spreading," he added.

395.title: Taapsee Pannu lists Mithali Raj's achievements, says 'You changed the game'
395.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu, who is portraying Mithali Raj in upcoming film 'Shabaash Mithu', took to social media to pen a note following the cricketer's retirement from international cricket. "Some personalities and their achievements are gender agnostic...You changed the game, now it's our turn to change the perspective!" she wrote, listing Mithali's achievements.

396.title: Govt issues high-severity warnings for Google Chrome & Mozilla Firefox users
396.article_body: The government's Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) recently flagged vulnerabilities in Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox products. Chrome versions prior to 96.0.4664.209 are affected with vulnerabilities which could be exploited by attackers, CERT-In said. Vulnerabilities in Firefox could allow attackers to disclose sensitive information, bypass security restrictions etc, it said.

397.title: I-T Dept mistakenly reduces TDS on virtual digital assets to 0.1%, corrects it to 1%
397.article_body: Income Tax Department portal on Wednesday updated its document on tax deducted at source (TDS), reiterating that TDS on payments made on the transfer of virtual digital assets remains at 1%, as stated in Budget. The website earlier mentioned that it has been dropped to 0.1%. However, after the change was noticed, the website updated the document rectifying the error.

398.title: Entire country stands with Kashmiri Pandits: Arvind Kejriwal
398.article_body: Greeting Kashmiri Pandits on 'Jyeshtha Ashtami', Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "I want to assure the Kashmiri Pandit community that the entire country is standing shoulder to shoulder with you in your...happiness and sorrow." His tweet comes amid the recent killings in Jammu and Kashmir. "May the blessings of Maa Kheer Bhavani always be with you all," Kejriwal tweeted.

399.title: Latest rankings for Test batters and bowlers released
399.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for Test batters and bowlers. England's Joe Root jumped to the second spot in batters' rankings, while New Zealand captain Kane Williamson dropped to the fifth spot. Meanwhile, New Zealand pacer Kyle Jamieson jumped to the third position in the bowlers' rankings. England pacer James Anderson jumped two spots to be ranked seventh.

400.title: Future belongs to the BJP: JP Nadda in Kolkata
400.article_body: Addressing the state executive committee meeting in Kolkata, BJP National President JP Nadda said the "future belongs to the BJP" and that his party will defeat TMC in the next elections. Criticising West Bengal's ruling party, he said, "The TMC has no principles or policies, it has only syndicates." He added, "In politics, there is nothing static, things change."

401.title: 2 independent MLAs join BJP in Himachal Pradesh
401.article_body: Two independent MLAs in Himachal Pradesh, Hoshiyar Singh and Prakash Rana, joined BJP on Wednesday in the presence of Chief Minister Jairam Thakur and state BJP President Suresh Kashyap. The independent legislators' joining would make the party and the government stronger, CM Thakur said. Both Singh and Rana had been supporting BJP in the Assembly for long, Suresh Kashyap said.

402.title: Rare 'Indian lipstick plant' spotted in Arunachal after over 100 years
402.article_body: A rare plant, sometimes called the 'Indian lipstick plant', has been rediscovered in the Anjaw district of Arunachal Pradesh after over 100 years, the Botanical Survey of India (BSI) researchers said. Aeschynanthus monetaria Dunn plant was last spotted in 1912 when English botanist Isaac Henry Burkill collected its samples. BSI scientist Krishna Chowlu found it again in December 2021.

403.title: Video shows Bengal CM dancing with tribals at mass wedding ceremony
403.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee danced with a group of tribal women during a mass wedding ceremony in North Bengal's Alipurduar. A video shows the Chief Minister blessing the newly-married couples. "Being part of the magnificent ceremony, she wholeheartedly celebrated and expressed her desire to see our Adivasi brothers and sisters achieve great heights of success," TMC tweeted.

404.title: Break ties with India: Imran Khan to Pak govt on Prophet remark row
404.article_body: Ex-Pakistani PM Imran Khan on Tuesday asked the country's government to sever ties with India and boycott Indian products in response to ex-BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad. Khan alleged that India had been allowed to get away with its "Islamophobic policies" so far. Countries including Qatar and Kuwait had summoned Indian envoys over the remarks.
